sections.title: Review with Curiosity
sections.content: Numbers tell the story of your values in action. A budget review is about understanding the story, not blaming yourself. Approach each line item with curiosity: What worked? What can improve?

points.title: Variance
points.description: Compare planned vs. actual spending for each category to spot trends.

points.title: Cash Flow
points.description: Check if income minus expenses still supports your goals.

points.title: Progress
points.description: Review savings and debt payoff contributions to ensure targets are met.

sections.title: Micro Adjustments

sections.title: When to Adjust
sections.content: Adjust categories when actual spending repeatedly exceeds the plan, life circumstances change, or new goals emerge. Reallocate from lower-priority areas to high-impact goals.

sections.title: Review Routine
steps: Schedule a recurring 30-minute monthly review on your calendar.
Export or view the past month's transactions and categorize variances.
Identify two categories to adjust up or down for next month.
Record at least one win (goal contribution, lower expense) to reinforce progress.
Set one focus area for the coming month (e.g., reduce dining by 10%).

sections.title: Future-Focused
sections.content: End each review by confirming next month's top goal so daily decisions align with your adjustments.
